author: Texas2904
body: DXC.  What brings this back from the dead and makes it better than buying any other crushed stock? I’m a big bag holder here and might bail.

author: meeni131
body:
Can't reveal most of them as not enough volume for some of the plays we're planning, but check out DXC. 

That one has been going through a reorg, it's been playing out well, and still tanked 70ish% in the past 6-7 months, crazy considering how much cash they generate so it's trading at less than 2x FCF today.

We'll probably pick up some super far out of the money 2022 calls on top of our shares; this looks like a $150 stock in a few years as they retire debt and buyback a ton of shares and still print money so literally went from being a potential 3x to a 10x

author: meeni131
body:
For LEAPs I generally like low-volatility stocks with an upcoming catalyst, especially if it's gotten crushed along with other companies and in a fairly less impacted industry. Some utilities, vendors in fairly closed, highly regulated industries (government, bank, or hospital vendors often good) are looking fantastic. Just picked up some $60 LEAPs for $0.50c (and a bunch of others on a spread) on a stock that's been in the $40-60 range for the past 2-3 years, is growing 20+% a year, likely to go to $80 once it picks back up and still be cheap, and is currently about $30. If this things hits $80 in the next 2 years that's a 50x+.

One I like that I noted in another thread was DXC where it's trading absurdly cheap vs fcf (<2x...), good new CEO, buybacks and debt retirement could make this a $150 stock in a few years and the $30 2022 leaps today are ~$2.50 when stock was at $60 just a few months ago and $40 just before the drop but it's taken about a 50% hit in the past couple weeks. Might go super out of the money here too for dirt cheap and wait it out. 

Would be awesome to have a couple 50-100x in the mix :)
